clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) Through an IPF Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Through an IPF Registry

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to create a database of demographics and samples in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine cellular and molecular determinants of IPF
primary_outcome.description: An IPF Registry is being established to assemble sufficient patients with IPF (especially in its earliest stage) for phase I therapeutic protocols. The Registry will incorporate demographic and clinical data for natural history studies; second, research data on physiology, high-resolution CT scan, questionnaires, and blood samples for blood banking to be collected every 6 months for prospective studies on pathophysiology; and third, response to standard therapies will be monitored to determine cellular and molecular relationships to clinical outcome and predictors of survival. This is done in order to better determine cellular and molecular determinants of IPF. This cohort will be large enough to commence a separate phase I protocol with molecular strategies of intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Male or Female greater or equal to age 18.
2. Referral by physician with the diagnosis of IPF, or interstitial lung disease (IPF considered likely).
Exclusion Criteria
(a) Unwilling or unable to give written informed consent.
